item.title: Report X-2023060367
item.description:
Report X-2023060367

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 6th, during the AM sort the station discovered an open FedEx envelope that contained 2 aerosol bottles of pepper spray. There were no indications on the outside of the package that shows this contained any dangerous goods. DG Admin advised then to hold the shipment until further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023060364
item.description:
Report X-2023060364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: SOMERVILLE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO SIX PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOX HAS HANDWRITTEN MARKING OF KEEP FROZEN. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO OTHER CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZA75Y171325221515, 1ZA75Y171315199864, 1ZA75Y171325746235, 1ZA75Y171335397371 AND 1ZA75Y171307390457. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM MA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A75Y17, VNDR, 2323 BROADWAY 207, OAKLAND CA 94612.

item.title: Report E-2023060172
item.description:
Report E-2023060172

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: CHICOPEE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one case of adhesive (un1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 2 of the inner metal 4 ounce cans had released 1 cup of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023060163
item.description:
Report E-2023060163

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 2404 pound forklift battery (un2794) had fallen over and had released 0.5 gallons of acid. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023060359
item.description:
Report X-2023060359

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAMINATED BY ANOTHER PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DESICION TREE AND APPRPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE LEAKER AND ALL AFFECTED PACKAGES WERE THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. AS THE RESPONDER WAS REMOVING THE CONTAMINATED PARTS OF THE AFFECTED OUTER PACKAGING, RESPONDER NOTICED 3 UNDECLARED AEROSOL CANS INSDE.

item.title: Report X-2023060358
item.description:
Report X-2023060358

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS PACKED WITH USED, UNCAPPED AEROSOL CANS. THE AEROSOL CANS PARTIALLY DISCHARGED IN TRANSIT. THE UNLOADER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE OUT AND HAD A MILD ODOR TO IT. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THEN DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023060357
item.description:
Report X-2023060357

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE SOUTH SORT AISLE. THERE THE SORTER NOTICED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID COMING OUT FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE EQUIPMENT DECONTAMANATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PRICESSING. IT WAS THERE THAT IT WAS DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023060199
item.description:
Report X-2023060199

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: NORTH BILLERICA
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on the floor laying down and the bottom was discovered wet immediately brought to QA where it was inspected and discovered leaking from a loose cap then placed in a damage hazmat bin until I was able to process it. DescribePack: Package failure was a loose cap and a glued shut plastic bag DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipper places absorbent sheets on the bottom of the box and on the top around the plastic container to prevent leakage the release was entirely contained the the pads and cardboard of the outer container

Report X-2023051338

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED 5 GALLON BUCKET THAT LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL AND TRANSPORTED BUCKET TO DMP FOR FUTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023051317
item.description:
Report X-2023051317

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD BY THE UNLOADER. HE DISCOVERED IT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE TRAILER. HE STOPPED, LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE AREA WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN BROUGHT TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING WHERE IT WAS DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023051261
item.description:
Report X-2023051261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SENT TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THERE THE SORTER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND HAD AN ODOR TO IT. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONCE SHEET, PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS CLEANED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECK LIST, AFTER FURTHER REVIEW IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found upside down and bottom of box had no tape on it. Placed box upright in bucket and took to QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: bottom half of box soaking wet, 1 jug had cap come loose and half of the seal broke off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cleaned up puddle using absorbent material, placed box upright in bucket, and took all to QA cage for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023050240
item.description:
Report X-2023050240

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: QUINCY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in QA. Box intact and dry. Internal packaging - paper surrounding broken glass bottle. DescribePack: Glass bottle broke, most likely due to mishandling DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put in hazmat bin.
